intro: Eleocharis congesta f. soranumaensis, commonly known as the Soranuma sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its botanical features include slender stems, narrow leaves, and tiny, inconspicuous flowers that develop into three-angled berries. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
